channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 5th November
item.description:
Parked up here for at least 6 months. Not owned by anyone who lives on this street. No MOT. Taking up a valuable space in an area with a scarcity of spaces

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Sun Lane, Kidbrooke, London

item.title: Sign is falling off, 5th November
item.description:
The Camera sign is not correctly placed and holding on with one bracket. The sign does impeded the bus as it is turning, where the bus can collide with the sign causing damage to our bus.

item.title: West side of Ropley Street not cleaned by council, 5th November
item.description:
I am not sure why, but the west side if Ropley Street is not cleaned by the council. We have asked them to do so many times and never had a response. The issue has now been reported over the last 5 years. The postcode is E2 7SW
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working, 5th November
item.description:
Street light not working at top of grierson road by the barrier. This is a v busy pedestrian street as nr station. The area is v dark now and unsafe. Please fix urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grierson Road, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned trailer, 5th November
item.description:
The trailer was abandoned and over one month ago the council pinned a notice to it saying the owner had a month to claim it. Following an investigation in response to this, the council have closed the issue because they say the owner has claimed it. However, it's still there in a delapitated condition including burst tyre with a pile of rubbish in it, it's still taking up parking space without paying and their deadline is up so needs to be removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Siward Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Young men taking drugs/playing loud music, 5th November
item.description:
Groups of male men smoking skunk/cannabis and playing loud music behind King Solomon’s academy on the open area park. Happens every night after the school has closed and is anti social and frightening for pedestrians and residents. Can the leader of Westminster Council and the Met Police come up with a plan to reduce this horrible situation. The urban planners have really ruined the area with this footpath which was once a road. It’s now totally been taken over by criminality and frightening behaviour and it seems the drug selling and use is being ignored by authorities.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lisson Street, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
